meanings.sent1: I like to stretch my arms in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to stretch after a nap.

meanings.definition: To reach or pull something in order to make it taut
meanings.sent1: She had to stretch the rubber band to shoot it.
meanings.sent2: He had to stretch the rope to secure the tent.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to stretch the dough to make a perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to stretch his muscles before the race.
meanings.sent5: The painter had to stretch the canvas tightly before starting the artwork.

meanings.definition: To make something wider or longer without tearing
meanings.sent1: She carefully tried to stretch the sweater over the chair.
meanings.sent2: He used a special tool to stretch the leather without damaging it.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal artist can stretch a balloon into various shapes.
meanings.sent4: The yoga instructor showed how to stretch the fabric gently.
meanings.sent5: The rubber band can stretch quite far without breaking.

meanings.definition: To extend beyond a normal limit
meanings.sent1: His explanation seemed to stretch the truth a bit.
meanings.sent2: The deadline had to stretch due to unexpected delays.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's tale seemed to stretch longer with each telling.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to stretch from ear to ear.
meanings.sent5: The road seemed to stretch endlessly into the horizon.

meanings.definition: A continuous area or expanse of land or water
meanings.sent1: The desert stretch seemed to go on forever.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful stretch of beach was perfect for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The vast stretch of ocean sparkled under the sun.
meanings.sent4: The green stretch of meadow was a peaceful place to relax.
meanings.sent5: The long stretch of road disappeared into the distance.
